importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the current baseball postseason narrative is being reported.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series, marking the beginning of the final postseason matchup between the Blue Jays and Dodgers.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The current year in which the World Series is being contested, placing the event within the context of ongoing baseball season developments.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have won the American League Championship Series against the Seattle Mariners in Game 7, securing their first World Series appearance since 1993.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll in MLB and a dominant postseason record, are the opposing team in the World Series.
The Dodgers have won two World Series titles and five National League pennants in the past nine seasons, making them one of the most successful franchises in recent years.

Shohei Ohtani delivered a historic performance in the NLCS, hitting three home runs and pitching 6.1 shutout innings with 10 strikeouts, a performance recognized as one of the greatest individual games in baseball history.

The Blue Jays' strong offensive performance, including 34 runs over four games in the ALDS, helped them overcome a tough ALCS against the Mariners, who were on a 2-0 series lead before collapsing in key games.
The Blue Jays' 94-68 regular-season record and their comeback from a last-place finish in 2024 highlight their significant turnaround and rise in competitiveness.
The Dodgers' bullpen has been a weakness, which could be exploited by the Blue Jays during the World Series.
The Blue Jays are considered a strong challenge due to their offensive prowess, though the Dodgers possess superior defensive and pitching depth.
The World Series opener is set for October 24, 2025, in Toronto, marking the culmination of the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series after defeating the Seattle Mariners in a seven-game ALCS, marking their first appearance since 1993.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the defending World Series team and will face the Blue Jays in the World Series, having won multiple postseason series and showcasing elite player performance, particularly from Shohei Ohtani.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, known for both hitting and pitching.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a standout performance in the NLCS, including three home runs and a dominant 6.1 shutout innings, contributing directly to the Dodgers' series win and earning recognition as one of the greatest individual games in baseball history.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the Blue Jays' opponents in the ALCS and were considered the only MLB franchise to have never reached the World Series, adding narrative tension to the series.

namedEntities.name: New York Yankees
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in New York, New York.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees were the Blue Jays' division rival during the ALDS, where Toronto's offense overwhelmed them with 34 runs over four games.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLDS, which demonstrated the Dodgers' strength in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLCS, contributing to the Dodgers' postseason dominance.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A key player for the Toronto Blue Jays, known for his power-hitting.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer hit a late three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS that ended the Mariners' hopes, turning the tide in the series.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays, who participated in the ALCS.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman expressed confidence in the team's ability to stay competitive throughout the ALCS, highlighting the team's resilience.

namedEntities.name: Pittsburgh Pirates
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Pirates defeated the Dodgers in a September sweep during the regular season, indicating the Dodgers' struggles in late-game performance.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series after a hard-fought seven-game victory over the Seattle Mariners in the American League Championship Series, marking their first appearance since 1993. They will face the Los Angeles Dodgers, who are the defending champions and the most dominant team in baseball over the past nine seasons, highlighted by Shohei Ohtaniâ€™s historic performance in the NLCS. While the Blue Jays have shown remarkable offensive strength and resilience, especially in the ALDS and ALCS, the Dodgers have a superior pitching staff and defensive foundation. However, the Dodgers' struggling bullpen presents a potential vulnerability. The World Series opener is set for October 24, 2025, in Toronto, making it a pivotal moment in the season's narrative.
title: Dodgers and Blue Jays Set for World Series Clash After ALCS Victory
